TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridTextBox extends System.Windows.Forms.TextBox

Docs.summary: Represents a control that is hosted in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataGridTextBox and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> work together so that users can directly edit values in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control column. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> derives from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>, and is designed to host the DataGridTextBox, which derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control.
In addition to the properties, events, and methods of the base control, you can call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown> events with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnKeyPress%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseDown%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to get the DataGridTextBox hosted by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn>.
[!code-cs[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_54_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_54_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic DataGridTextBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.d_54_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the is in a mode that allows either editing or navigating.
Docs.value: if the controls is in navigation mode, and editing has not begun; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IsInEditOrNavigateMode property is used within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessKeyMessage%2A> to determine how to process key press events, to check the state of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox>. For example, if one of the navigation (arrow) keys is pressed, the appropriate action for the state of the control must occur.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member.
[!code-cs[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_69_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.d_69_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[DataGridTextBox_IsInEditOrNavigateMode#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_69_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the key pressed is processed further (for example, to navigate, or escape). This property is read-only.
Docs.returns: if the key is consumed, to if the key is further processed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called when a control receives a keyboard message.
